title: Ping Throttling? 226 megabit download and 15ms ping on speedtest.net but never below 65ms in-game

embed.description: Tinypic™ is a photo and video sharing service that allows you to easily upload, link and share your images and videos on MySpace®, eBay®, blogs and message boards. No account required, upload your photos and videos today!

body:
I posted this in Bugs and someone had me run tracert and suggested I come here based on the results.

Is 65ms normal even with pingtest regularly giving me 15 and as low as 10ms and no packet loss? Is it because I'm in California and the servers got moved to the east coast maybe? I really hope it's not that nobody on the entire west coast can expect much better than 65ms =/

replies.body:
The latency you're seeing is fairly normal for the east coast, depending on your ISP and network routing, you could see a ~10ms dip either way in your latency maybe. Your traceroute has some basic information, but I'd like to see an in-depth look at your network routing using a proper traceroute with [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/). After loading up the app, plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field and start the trace. After the trace has run for about 5 minutes, export the results as text and paste them in a reply.

Let me know if you run into any issues with those steps.

It looks like your latency inside your home network is pretty high, though it could be reasonable if you're on a wireless connection and not too close to the router. After your connection leaves your local network, your latency along your route basically sees consistent spikes in the low 100s before reaching our servers. I'd recommend reaching out to your ISP's tier 2 support and provide this traceroute so they can start an investigation.

Let me know if you have any other questions.
I was wireless, but the router is right on the other side of the room.  Should I maybe run a test while connected via ethernet and show you those results first?
Sure, that would be a good idea.
